intro: Carex neodigyna, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. Native to parts of North America, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features include small, three-lobed flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. Carex neodigyna plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
